content:
• Friday, September 16, 2011
  • UTX

    Some of United Technologies (NYSE:UTX) other rumored acquisition targets aren't faring so well...

    Some of United Technologies (NYSE:UTX) other rumored acquisition targets aren't faring so well after hours: Textron (TXT -2.5%), Rockwell Collins (COL -3.5%), Tyco (TYC -1.4%).
     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM
  • UTX

    A United Technologies (NYSE:UTX) deal, which may come early next week, could value Goodrich...

    A United Technologies (NYSE:UTX) deal, which may come early next week, could value Goodrich (NYSE:GR) at $110-$125 per share.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • GR

    Goodrich (NYSE:GR) soars +22% in after-hours trading after CNBC reports United Techologies...

    Goodrich (NYSE:GR) soars +22% in after-hours trading after CNBC reports United Techologies (NYSE:UTX) is making a bid for the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM
  • WR

    Westar Energy (NYSE:WR) raises its FY11 guidance due to an expected benefit stemming from the...

    Westar Energy (NYSE:WR) raises its FY11 guidance due to an expected benefit stemming from the settlement of a legal dispute, plus a gain on the disposition of an investment written off in 1998. It now says FY11 EPS will be around $1.88-$2.03, above consensus estimates of $1.70. Shares +1.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • CAG

    Ralcorp (RAH -4%) shares slide before the close, as bearish options trading suggests ConAgra's...

    Ralcorp (RAH -4%) shares slide before the close, as bearish options trading suggests ConAgra's (CAG +1.3%) attempted takeover offer for the company is in jeopardy. ConAgra has said it will walk away unless the two firms are "engaged in a constructive dialogue" by next Monday.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • MA

    MasterCard (MA -2%) continues to drift lower following a downgrade to neutral on valuation at...

    MasterCard (MA -2%) continues to drift lower following a downgrade to neutral on valuation at Baird. Separately, RBC is defending the stock, saying it's still attractive, even at current lofty levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • EXEL

    Shares of Exelixis (EXEL -5%) spike lower on speculation of negative clinical trial data.

    Shares of Exelixis (EXEL -5%) spike lower on speculation of negative clinical trial data.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • MCS

    The Marcus Corp. (NYSE:MCS) tacks on another 7% gain, after soaring 17.6% yesterday on a...

    The Marcus Corp. (NYSE:MCS) tacks on another 7% gain, after soaring 17.6% yesterday on a well-received earnings beat. A strong summer slate of films kicked up earnings, as the firm looks to Moneyball, Footloose, The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1 and The Muppets to repeat the trick in Q3 and Q4.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • INSM

    Insmed (NASDAQ:INSM), whose shares collapsed in August on bad regulatory news, is up 10.7% after...

    Insmed (NASDAQ:INSM), whose shares collapsed in August on bad regulatory news, is up 10.7% after Wedbush starts coverage with an Outperform and $15 PT. The firm thinks the FDA will lift the clinical hold it's placed on studies of Insmed's Arikace drug in late September or early October, and that the drug can address a $300M opportunity.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • WMGI

    Wright Medical Group (WMGI +6.6%) is up after reaching an agreement yesterday with the New...

    Wright Medical Group (WMGI +6.6%) is up after reaching an agreement yesterday with the New Jersey Attorney General and the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services OIG to extend its deferred prosecution agreement related to a kickback scheme for one year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • CCOI

    Shares of Internet service provider Cogent Communications (CCOI +9.7%) have taken off in the...

    Shares of Internet service provider Cogent Communications (CCOI +9.7%) have taken off in the last hour, reportedly on account of positive remarks made by the company's CEO.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • IDA

    Idaho Power holding company Idacorp (IDA +2.2%) gains after receiving the stamp of approval from...

    Idaho Power holding company Idacorp (IDA +2.2%) gains after receiving the stamp of approval from a Congressional joint committee for its previously agreed upon tax changes with the IRS. The changes will enable the power supplier to recognize around $57M of previously unrecognized tax benefits for 2009 and prior years.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • OPEN

    Shares of OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN) are down 4.4%, not getting any help from Barclays after the...

    Shares of OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN) are down 4.4%, not getting any help from Barclays after the firm initiates coverage with an Underweight rating and a $60 price target. CEO Matthew Roberts remains positive - saying the firm has revenue potential on mobile platforms (video).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • WLL

    Whiting Petroleum (WLL +1.1%) gains after Capital One ups it to strong buy on valuation, citing...

    Whiting Petroleum (WLL +1.1%) gains after Capital One ups it to strong buy on valuation, citing an increase in production targets from its Bakken formation stake.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) post a tidy 4.4% gain after a liquidator announces the...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) post a tidy 4.4% gain after a liquidator announces the company won the intellectual property of Borders Group in a bankruptcy auction. Though details won't be released until after Sept. 20, the trade names Waldenbooks and Borders, web sites and other trademarks were some of the items up for bidding.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • GORO

    Gold Resource Corporation (GORO +4.5%) responds to multiple negative pieces published by a...

    Gold Resource Corporation (GORO +4.5%) responds to multiple negative pieces published by a website known as The Street Sweeper - saying it believes it's being targeted by individuals or groups holding short positions in its securities in an effort to manipulate the company's stock price.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • BB

    Criticism of Research In Motion's (RIMM -18.5%) leadership is easy to find today. Deutsche Bank,...

    Criticism of Research In Motion's (RIMM -18.5%) leadership is easy to find today. Deutsche Bank, which sees "no sign of a turnaround," thinks management appears oblivious to the size of RIM's challenges; and JMP believes RIM's plans to increase PlayBook promotions in spite of terrible sales calls its judgment into question. (RIMM FQ2) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • PCXCQ

    A dicey production report from Patriot Coal (PCX -9.4%) is filtering down to other coal stocks,...

    A dicey production report from Patriot Coal (PCX -9.4%) is filtering down to other coal stocks, as investors ponder who might be next in line. Decliners: ACI -2.8%, BTU -2.5%, WLT -2.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM | 4 Comments
  • KGJI

    Another company says it is under attack from short sellers: Kingold Jewelry (NASDAQ:KGJI) names...

    Another company says it is under attack from short sellers: Kingold Jewelry (NASDAQ:KGJI) names names in a letter to shareholders and claims a report from a blogger contains fabrications. It's surely not a shock to followers of scandal-tainted microcaps... Kingold operates out of China. Shares up +8.8% on the rebuttal.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • IAG

    IAMGOLD (IAG +6%) pops on an HSBC upgrade to overweight on valuation with a $30 price target.

    IAMGOLD (IAG +6%) pops on an HSBC upgrade to overweight on valuation with a $30 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • JCI

    Tyco (TYC +3.5%) gives back some of its early gains after CNBC's David Faber says United...

    Tyco (TYC +3.5%) gives back some of its early gains after CNBC's David Faber says United Technologies' (UTX -0.2%) financing deal was for substantially less than $20B and not intended for a purchase of Tyco. A Reuters report had said UTX was seeking financing for an acquisition in the "double-digit billions." GR, +6.5%, and COL , +9.4%, hold gains from the initial Reuters story.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • INTC

    The Dow is making a charge to close up five consecutive sessions, led by top gainer Intel (INTC...

    The Dow is making a charge to close up five consecutive sessions, led by top gainer Intel (INTC +1.8%). Yesterday, the chipmaker raised a whopping $5B in the bond market with the issuance of 5, 10 and 30-yr bonds that priced out with higher yields than forecast.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • ZINCQ

    Specialty zinc producer Horsehead Holdings (ZINC +7.1%) pops after FBR Capital raises it to...

    Specialty zinc producer Horsehead Holdings (ZINC +7.1%) pops after FBR Capital raises it to outperform on valuation and bumps its price target to $15 from $13. FBR notes the stock is off 46% from its April high, and should benefit from some positive near-term catalysts.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • WSO

    Heating and air conditioning manufacturer Watsco (WSO -1.7%) is lower today after UBS cut it to...

    Heating and air conditioning manufacturer Watsco (WSO -1.7%) is lower today after UBS cut it to sell on valuation, citing a weaker macroeconomic environment and an unfavorable outlook for its U.S. housing and consumer end-markets.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • VECO

    Veeco Instruments (VECO -3.3%) is lower on a Lazard downgrade to neutral, citing a bigger...

    Veeco Instruments (VECO -3.3%) is lower on a Lazard downgrade to neutral, citing a bigger slowdown in China that could impact the company's outlook for the first half of 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • SSYS

    Stratasys (SSYS -8%) gets hit after Needham cuts it to hold on concerns over the strength of its...

    Stratasys (SSYS -8%) gets hit after Needham cuts it to hold on concerns over the strength of its Fortus 3D production system business and overall demand for the low-end of the company's products.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • PMTI

    Palomar Medical Technologies (PMTI +4.9%) trades higher after settling its patent infringement...

    Palomar Medical Technologies (PMTI +4.9%) trades higher after settling its patent infringement lawsuits with Syneron Medical (ELOS +4.6%). Under the agreement, Syneron will pay $31M to Palomar for a license to patents on professional laser and lamp-based hair removal systems.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • BABY

    Natus Medical (BABY +6.6%) pops after saying it's acquiring privately held Embla Systems, which...

    Natus Medical (BABY +6.6%) pops after saying it's acquiring privately held Embla Systems, which makes devices used in diagnosing sleep apnea, for $16.1M in cash. Natus says the deal should add around $0.08 per share to its adjusted earnings in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • GILD

    Gilead Sciences (GILD +1.9%) is trading higher after Goldman ups the shares to Buy, calling it...

    Gilead Sciences (GILD +1.9%) is trading higher after Goldman ups the shares to Buy, calling it "the stock to own" given the value of its core business, a solid pipeline of HIV drugs, and the potential for longer-term estimates to rise.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • AMSC

    American Superconductor (AMSC -5.5%) takes a hit this morning after Wunderlich downgrades the...

    American Superconductor (AMSC -5.5%) takes a hit this morning after Wunderlich downgrades the shares to hold. Wunderlich says the company lost a key customer after an employee stole secret code and sold it to its largest competitor.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • EBAY

    eBay (EBAY +2.3%) rises after Wedbush upgrades shares to Outperform, and lifts its PT to $48, on...

    eBay (EBAY +2.3%) rises after Wedbush upgrades shares to Outperform, and lifts its PT to $48, on bullishness regarding eBay's PayPal unit. The firm believes PayPal will continue growing at a 25-30% clip, and will account for over half of eBay's revenue by 2014. A new in-store payment system is seen as a key growth driver. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • ENDP

    Endo Pharmaceuticals Holdings (ENDP -0.8%) is down after a subsidiary voluntarily recalls...

    Endo Pharmaceuticals Holdings (ENDP -0.8%) is down after a subsidiary voluntarily recalls multiple lots of birth-control pills due to a packaging error that could cause women to take the contraceptives incorrectly, putting them at risk of unintended pregnancy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • ADBE

    Adobe (ADBE -2.5%) drops after JMP's Patrick Walvarens downgrades shares to Market Perform and...

    Adobe (ADBE -2.5%) drops after JMP's Patrick Walvarens downgrades shares to Market Perform and trims EPS estimates. Walvarens is concerned about the near-term succes of Adobe's enterprise business, and its ability to retain management and sales personnel. The fact Adobe's shares trade below late-2004 levels probably doesn't help with the latter.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • FOE

    Moody's upgrades Ferro (FOE +1.4%) a notch to Ba3 on improved cash flow, better operating...

    Moody's upgrades Ferro (FOE +1.4%) a notch to Ba3 on improved cash flow, better operating performance and lower debt levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • BNPQY

    A sharp dive in French bank shares in the last few minutes is weakening another strong rally in...

    A sharp dive in French bank shares in the last few minutes is weakening another strong rally in Europe. BNP Paribas (OTCQX:BNPQY) -9% in Paris after being unchanged not long ago. Credit Agricole (OTCPK:CRARY) -5%, SocGen (OTCPK:SCGLY) -2.7% after being strongly green most of the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • HD

    Home improvement companies are tacking on some gains after a consumer sentiment gauge came in...

    Home improvement companies are tacking on some gains after a consumer sentiment gauge came in better than expected. Gainers: HD +1.8%, LOW +1.6% and even global player OTCQX:KGFHY +2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • AXLL

    Georgia Gulf (GGC +7.1%) pops after the firm announces it will retire $42M of debt prior to its...

    Georgia Gulf (GGC +7.1%) pops after the firm announces it will retire $42M of debt prior to its maturity date. Shares were up over 10% at the open before tailing off.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • MEET

    Latin social networking site Quepasa (QPSA) rises 8.7% after announcing its merger agreement...

    Latin social networking site Quepasa (QPSA) rises 8.7% after announcing its merger agreement with myYearbook was amended to remove a condition requiring Quepasa's shares trade at $5 or more, and to fix the number of shares issued to myYearbook at 17M. The cash portion of Quepasa's acquisition cost ($18M) remains unchanged.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • AMTD

    TD Ameritrade (NASDAQ:AMTD) founder Joe Ricketts says he will retire next month, fresh off...

    TD Ameritrade (NASDAQ:AMTD) founder Joe Ricketts says he will retire next month, fresh off helping the board nix an acquisition of E-Trade (ETFC +1.1%). The company says Todd Ricketts - currently a director with the Chicago Cubs - will take over his father's position. Shares of AMTD are up 2.5% on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) is down another 5.4% today, as investors continue punishing the company...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) is down another 5.4% today, as investors continue punishing the company following yesterday's subscriber guidance cut. A downgrade by Caris and a PT reduction from Oppneheimer probably aren't helping matters either. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • UTX

    Reuters reports United Technologies (NYSE:UTX) is arranging financing "in the double-digit...

    Reuters reports United Technologies (NYSE:UTX) is arranging financing "in the double-digit billions" for a major acquisition. Potential targets: Tyco TYC +7.5%, Textron TXT +7.4%, Rockwell Collins COL +6.5%, Goodrich GR +3%, Ingersoll-Rand IR +2.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • PCXCQ

    Patriot Coal (PCX) drops 7.3% after announcing its coal production will decline by 450K tons in...

    Patriot Coal (PCX) drops 7.3% after announcing its coal production will decline by 450K tons in Q3, primarily due to geological issues affecting 2 mines, and the early closure of another mine. As a result, Patriot expects the average cost per ton for its Appalachian miners to several dollars higher than prior guidance. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM) is down 19.2%, as multiple firms downgrade the struggling smartphone...

    Research In Motion (RIMM) is down 19.2%, as multiple firms downgrade the struggling smartphone vendor following soft FQ2 results featuring disappointing shipment figures and major cash burn. Canaccord remains downbeat (I, II), believing RIM's gross margin will stay weak; but previously-bearish Wedge Partners thinks the company may be bottoming.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • REV

    Shares of Revlon (REV +7.1%) soar after BMO Capital upgrades to Outperform from Market Perform...

    Shares of Revlon (REV +7.1%) soar after BMO Capital upgrades to Outperform from Market Perform with a new price target of $21 - repping 62% upside potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • RPXC

    RPX Corp. (NASDAQ:RPXC), a provider of patent licensing services to major corporations, is up...

    RPX Corp. (NASDAQ:RPXC), a provider of patent licensing services to major corporations, is up 10.7% after pricing a follow-on offering of 3M shares at $20.49/share. RPX had previously raised $159.6M in a May IPO.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • COL

    Goldman Sachs gives shares of Rockwell Collins (COL +0.8%) a lift by raising estimates for EPS...

    Goldman Sachs gives shares of Rockwell Collins (COL +0.8%) a lift by raising estimates for EPS above consensus and upping its price target to $56 from $55. The stock is up 8% since the company reaffirmed guidance and issued a stock buyback increase earlier this week.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • JOE

    Florida real estate developer St. Joe (NYSE:JOE) is up 7.1% premarket after disclosing a...

    Florida real estate developer St. Joe (NYSE:JOE) is up 7.1% premarket after disclosing a stockholder agreement with activist investor Fairholme Funds that allows the money manager to "acquire beneficial ownership" of up to 50% of St. Joe's common stock, up from a prior 30%. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP) says it has broken off talks with Sumitomo on a prospective financing deal...

    Molycorp (MCP) says it has broken off talks with Sumitomo on a prospective financing deal because the investment is "no longer necessary" in implementing its business plan. In the original offer, Sumitomo would buy $100M of the rare earth miner's shares and provide $30M in debt financing. MCP +3.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • NDN

    Premarket gainers: NDN +11%. RPXC +4%. NCP +4%. BCS +4%. LYG +3%. MTU +3%. DB +3%.Losers: RIMM...

    Premarket gainers: NDN +11%. RPXC +4%. NCP +4%. BCS +4%. LYG +3%. MTU +3%. DB +3%.
    Losers: RIMM -23%. AGP -10%. PCX -7%. RTH -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • ETN

    Cooper Industries (CBE) issues downward guidance for Q3 and full-year 2011, citing cost...

    Cooper Industries (CBE) issues downward guidance for Q3 and full-year 2011, citing cost pressures and production shortfalls as well as “sales softness” in its residential and commercial-facing businesses. Preliminary outlook for 2012 is for mid-single-digit core revenue growth and double-digit EPS, CEO Kirk Hachigian says. CBE -6.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • ANTM

    Amerigroup (AGP) raises its forecast for the ratio of premium revenue spent on patient care,...

    Amerigroup (AGP) raises its forecast for the ratio of premium revenue spent on patient care, citing continued rising medical costs. The Medicaid insurer revises the projected range for its 2011 health benefits ratio to 83.9%-84.9%, up from 83.1%-84.1% previously, according to an SECfiling. AGP -10.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM
  • NDN

    Shares of 99 Cents Only Stores (NYSE:NDN) soar 12% premarket after a report in the New York Post...

    Shares of 99 Cents Only Stores (NYSE:NDN) soar 12% premarket after a report in the New York Post says Apollo Management will bid between $22-$24 a share to acquire the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:06 AM
